Class Battery

java.lang.Object
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Battery
public class Battery extends Component
Represents a battery component in the circuit simulator. The battery has two ports: a positive terminal and a negative terminal. When both ports are connected, it applies a fixed output voltage across them. The battery does not rely on incoming voltage; it acts as a power source and is always considered "powered".

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Battery

      public Battery(javafx.scene.image.ImageView view, double voltage)
      Constructs a Battery with the given image view and output voltage.
      Parameters:
      view - the ImageView representing the battery's visual
      voltage - the fixed voltage the battery supplies when connected

  • Method Details

    • simulate

      public void simulate()
      Simulates the battery behavior. If both terminals are connected, it sets the positive port to the output voltage and the negative port to 0V (ground). Otherwise, resets to 0V.
      Specified by:
      simulate in class Component

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets all internal and port voltages to 0V.
      Overrides:
      reset in class Component

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the battery from any connected components. This clears all port connections and resets internal voltage state.
      Overrides:
      disconnect in class Component

    • getPorts

      public List<Port> getPorts()
      Returns the list of ports belonging to this battery.
      Specified by:
      getPorts in class Component
      Returns:
      a list containing the positive and negative ports

    • isPowered

      public boolean isPowered()
      Always returns true since the battery is inherently a power source.
      Specified by:
      isPowered in class Component
      Returns:
      true

    • propagatePower

      public void propagatePower(Set<Component> visited)
      Propagates power to all components connected to the positive and negative ports. Uses a visited set to prevent infinite recursion.
      Specified by:
      propagatePower in class Component
      Parameters:
      visited - the set of components already visited during propagation
